page.title: 12 Tamworth Football Club.
page.content: Tamworth Football Club began life playing on the Castle Grounds with the name of Tamworth Castle Football Club. They moved to {The Lamb}, their present ground, in 1934. Over the years the team has played in a variety of leagues and competitions: the Southern League; the Northern Premier League; the Birmingham Combination; the Midland Floodlit Cup and at present the West Midland League. The club also has a great reputation in the world famous {F.A. Cup} competition reaching the first round proper on a number of occasions in the sixties. Their {present kit} is red shirts, white shorts and red socks. The ground comprises three entrance gates, a grandstand, a covered standing area, a clubhouse and dressing rooms.
